Try running the appropriate crack after install, make sure the app is closed. In my instance, I ran the install, applied the automated cracking 2, then launched the program and used the last serial # on the list. Registered successfully, unchecked automatic update option. Running Windows 7 pro x86.

If the Serial is still showing as invalid follow these Instructions please:
"Xilisoft added a hidden registry key, which wont allow you to add any more keys after the first key gets blocked. So here is a workaround:
1-Start
2-Run
3-Type in Regedit
4-Select HKEY_USERS
5-Press Ctrl + f (Search)
6-Search for {C06F4056-C35F-4bf8-A93A-9F098F3E503D}
7-Delete the Key, including the subkeys"

Credits to blackboxcard for writing the Instructions.
Yep, hidden regristry!!!  Works, and Automatic updates unchecked.  back up and running again.  Thanks

But Chatti, why do you always use that awful "launcher program" of yours? Why can't we just have the program and it's cures the simple way?

If anybody wants to separate the installer and the crack from this pack, then start the launcher program - it then extracts all of its contents to %Temp% dir and inside ir_ext_temp_0 > AutoPlay > Docs you'll find them.
If you close the launcher program, then ir_ext_temp_0 gets erased.

This was working now it's not. Tried every solution on here. Removal of the registry key doesn't work any more. It always comes back. Manually moving the crack doesn't work. Uninstall/reinstall doesn't work. Been downloading Xilisoft cracks for a long time and none of them ever last. None.

There must be some other hidden registry key the program adds? Maybe multiple keys?

Actually, let me say this: I can use the program but I have to add the name/serial every time I use it, because after I close it it reverts back to trial. I have to do this every time I use it, the crack is not sticking for some reason.

But I will say thanks for the work, CC, not disparaging you here.

Hello, 

Can anyone tell me why this would not install what-so-ever for me in Windows 7 until I turned OFF SpyBot? I know about False-positives, but you would see my other anti-malwares goin' off as well, avast, Norton 360, Lavasoft, etc. Only Spybot, which is aimed toward spyware & not trojans/worms/viruses/adware, was preventing this download. I'm curious as to why...

I tried to extract the executable so I can install just the package I needed, but then the executable is password-protected so that you MUST install the application using the circumvented package...and thus, making you install also whatever Spybot was red-flagging. 

Same thing happened to me with version 7.0.1

So, I'm curious!!
